BitField.Name: VERSION[31:0]
BitField.Notes: Version number. Unique to all cores. Default value: 0x00000000

BitField.Name: ID[31:0]
BitField.Notes: Instance identifier number. Default value: 0x00000000

BitField.Name: SCRATCH[31:0]
BitField.Notes: Scratch register. Default value: 0x00000000

BitField.Name: IQCORRECTION_DISABLE
BitField.Notes: If set, indicates that the IQ Correction module was not implemented. (as a result of a configuration of the IP instance) Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: DCFILTER_DISABLE
BitField.Notes: If set, indicates that the DC Filter module was not implemented. (as a result of a configuration of the IP instance) Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: DATAFORMAT_DISABLE
BitField.Notes: If set, indicates that the Data Format module was not implemented. (as a result of a configuration of the IP instance) Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: USERPORTS_DISABLE
BitField.Notes: If set, indicates that the logic related to the User Data Format (e.g. decimation) was not implemented. (as a result of a configuration of the IP instance) Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: MODE_1R1T
BitField.Notes: If set, indicates that the core was implemented in 1 channel mode. (e.g. refer to AD9361 data sheet) Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: DELAY_CONTROL_DISABLE
BitField.Notes: If set, indicates that the delay control is disabled for this IP. (as a result of a configuration of the IP instance) Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: DDS_DISABLE
BitField.Notes: If set, indicates that the DDS is disabled for this IP. (as a result of a configuration of the IP instance) Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: CMOS_OR_LVDS_N
BitField.Notes: CMOS or LVDS mode is used for the interface. (as a result of a configuration of the IP instance) Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: PPS_RECEIVER_ENABLE
BitField.Notes: If set, indicates the PPS receiver is enabled. (as a result of a configuration of the IP instance) Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: SCALECORRECTION_ONLY
BitField.Notes: If set, indicates that the IQ Correction module implements only scale correction. IQ correction must be enabled. (as a result of a configuration of the IP instance) Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: PPS_IRQ_MASK
BitField.Notes: Mask bit for the 1PPS receiver interrupt Default value: 0x1

Register.Name: REG_FPGA_INFO
Register.Description: FPGA device information [[https://github.com/analogdevicesinc/hdl/blob/master/library/scripts/adi_intel_device_info_enc.tcl |Intel encoded values]] [[https://github.com/analogdevicesinc/hdl/blob/master/library/scripts/adi_xilinx_device_info_enc.tcl |Xilinx encoded values]] (REG_FPGA_INFO)

BitField.Name: FPGA_TECHNOLOGY
BitField.Notes: Encoded value describing the technology/generation of the FPGA device (arria 10/7series) Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: FPGA_FAMILY
BitField.Notes: Encoded value describing the family variant of the FPGA device(e.g., SX, GX, GT or zynq, kintex, virtex) Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: SPEED_GRADE
BitField.Notes: Encoded value describing the FPGA's speed-grade Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: DEV_PACKAGE
BitField.Notes: Encoded value describing the device package. The package might affect high-speed interfaces Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: CE_N
BitField.Notes: Clock enable, default is enabled(0x0). An inverse version of the signal is exported out of the module to control clock enables Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: MMCM_RSTN
BitField.Notes: MMCM reset only (required for DRP access). Reset, default is IN-RESET (0x0), software must write 0x1 to bring up the core. Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: RSTN
BitField.Notes: Reset, default is IN-RESET (0x0), software must write 0x1 to bring up the core. Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: SYNC
BitField.Notes: Initialize synchronization between multiple ADCs Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: R1_MODE
BitField.Notes: Select number of RF channels 1 (0x1) or 2 (0x0). Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: DDR_EDGESEL
BitField.Notes: Select rising edge (0x0) or falling edge (0x1) for the first part of a sample (if applicable) followed by the successive edges for the remaining parts. This only controls how the sample is delineated from the incoming data post DDR registers. Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: PIN_MODE
BitField.Notes: Select interface pin mode to be clock multiplexed (0x1) or pin multiplexed (0x0). In clock multiplexed mode, samples are received on alternative clock edges. In pin multiplexed mode, samples are interleaved or grouped on the pins at the same clock edge. Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: CLK_FREQ[31:0]
BitField.Notes: Interface clock frequency. This is relative to the processor clock and in many cases is 100MHz. The number is represented as unsigned 16.16 format. Assuming a 100MHz processor clock the minimum is 1.523kHz and maximum is 6.554THz. The actual interface clock is CLK_FREQ * CLK_RATIO (see below). Note that the actual sampling clock may not be the same as the interface clock- software must consider device specific implementation parameters to calculate the final sampling clock. Default value: 0x0000

BitField.Name: CLK_RATIO[31:0]
BitField.Notes: Interface clock ratio - as a factor actual received clock. This is implementation specific and depends on any serial to parallel conversion and interface type (ddr/sdr/qdr). Default value: 0x0000

BitField.Name: PN_ERR
BitField.Notes: If set, indicates pn error in one or more channels. Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: PN_OOS
BitField.Notes: If set, indicates pn oos in one or more channels. Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: OVER_RANGE
BitField.Notes: If set, indicates over range in one or more channels. Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: STATUS
BitField.Notes: Interface status, if set indicates no errors. If not set, there are errors, software may try resetting the cores. Default value: 0x0

Register.Name: REG_DELAY_CNTRL (''Deprecated from version 9'')
Register.Description: ADC Interface Control & Status (REG_DELAY_CNTRL (''Deprecated from version 9''))

BitField.Name: DELAY_SEL
BitField.Notes: Delay select, a 0x0 to 0x1 transition in this register initiates a delay access controlled by the registers below. Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: DELAY_RWN
BitField.Notes: Delay read (0x1) or write (0x0), the delay is accessed directly (no increment or decrement) with an address corresponding to each pin, and data corresponding to the total delay. Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: DELAY_ADDRESS[7:0]
BitField.Notes: Delay address, the range depends on the interface pins, data pins are usually at the lower range. Default value: 0x00

BitField.Name: DELAY_WDATA[4:0]
BitField.Notes: Delay write data, a value of 1 corresponds to (1/200)ns for most devices. Default value: 0x0

Register.Name: REG_DELAY_STATUS (''Deprecated from version 9'')
Register.Description: ADC Interface Control & Status (REG_DELAY_STATUS (''Deprecated from version 9''))

BitField.Name: DELAY_LOCKED
BitField.Notes: Indicates delay locked (0x1) state. If this bit is read 0x0, delay control has failed to calibrate the elements. Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: DELAY_STATUS
BitField.Notes: If set, indicates busy status (access pending). The read data may not be valid if this bit is set. Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: DELAY_RDATA[4:0]
BitField.Notes: Delay read data, current delay value in the elements Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: ADC_SYNC
BitField.Notes: ADC synchronization status. Will be set to 1 after the synchronization has been completed Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: DRP_RWN
BitField.Notes: DRP read (0x1) or write (0x0) select (does not include GTX lanes). NOT-APPLICABLE if DRP_DISABLE is set (0x1). Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: DRP_ADDRESS[11:0]
BitField.Notes: DRP address, designs that contain more than one DRP accessible primitives have selects based on the most significant bits (does not include GTX lanes). NOT-APPLICABLE if DRP_DISABLE is set (0x1). Default value: 0x00

BitField.Name: RESERVED[15:0]
BitField.Notes: Reserved for backward compatibility. Default value: 0x0000

BitField.Name: DRP_LOCKED
BitField.Notes: If set indicates that the DRP has been locked. Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: DRP_STATUS
BitField.Notes: If set indicates busy (access pending). The read data may not be valid if this bit is set (does not include GTX lanes). NOT-APPLICABLE if DRP_DISABLE is set (0x1). Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: RESERVED[15:0]
BitField.Notes: Reserved for backward compatibility. Default value: 0x00

BitField.Name: DRP_WDATA[15:0]
BitField.Notes: DRP write data (does not include GTX lanes). NOT-APPLICABLE if DRP_DISABLE is set (0x1). Default value: 0x00

BitField.Name: DRP_RDATA[15:0]
BitField.Notes: DRP read data (does not include GTX lanes). Default value: 0x00

BitField.Name: UI_OVF
BitField.Notes: User Interface overflow. If set, indicates an overflow occurred during data transfer at the user interface (FIFO interface). Software must write a 0x1 to clear this register bit. Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: UI_UNF
BitField.Notes: User Interface underflow. If set, indicates an underflow occurred during data transfer at the user interface (FIFO interface). Software must write a 0x1 to clear this register bit. Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: UI_RESERVED
BitField.Notes: Reserved for backward compatibility. Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: USR_CHANMAX[7:0]
BitField.Notes: This indicates the maximum number of inputs for the channel data multiplexers. User may add different processing modules post data capture as another input to this common multiplexer. NOT-APPLICABLE if USERPORTS_DISABLE is set (0x1). Default value: 0x00

BitField.Name: ADC_START_CODE[31:0]
BitField.Notes: This sets the startcode that is used by the ADCs for synchronization NOT-APPLICABLE if START_CODE_DISABLE is set (0x1). Default value: 0x00000000

BitField.Name: ADC_GPIO_IN[31:0]
BitField.Notes: This reads auxiliary GPI pins of the ADC core Default value: 0x00000000

BitField.Name: ADC_GPIO_OUT[31:0]
BitField.Notes: This controls auxiliary GPO pins of the ADC core NOT-APPLICABLE if GPIO_DISABLE is set (0x1). Default value: 0x00000000

BitField.Name: PPS_COUNTER[31:0]
BitField.Notes: Counts the core clock cycles (can be a device clock or interface clock) between two 1PPS pulse. Default value: 0x00000000

BitField.Name: PPS_STATUS
BitField.Notes: If this bit is asserted there is no incomming 1PPS signal. Maybe the source is out of sync or it's not active. Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: PROFILE_SEL
BitField.Notes: Selects one of the available deframer/framers from the transport layer. Valid only if ''PROFILE_NUM'' > 1.

BitField.Name: PROFILE_NUM
BitField.Notes: Number of supported framer/deframer profiles.

BitField.Name: JESD_F
BitField.Notes: Octets per Frame per Lane.

BitField.Name: JESD_S
BitField.Notes: Samples per Converter per Frame.

BitField.Name: JESD_L
BitField.Notes: Lane Count.

BitField.Name: JESD_M
BitField.Notes: Converter Count.

BitField.Name: JESD_N
BitField.Notes: Converter Resolution.

BitField.Name: JESD_NP
BitField.Notes: Total Number of Bits per Sample.

BitField.Name: ADC_LB_OWR
BitField.Notes: If set, forces ADC_DATA_SEL to 1, enabling data loopback Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: ADC_PN_SEL_OWR
BitField.Notes: If set, forces ADC_PN_SEL to 0x9, device specific pn (e.g. ad9361) If both ADC_PN_TYPE_OWR and ADC_PN_SEL_OWR are set, they are ignored Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: IQCOR_ENB
BitField.Notes: if set, enables IQ correction or scale correction. NOT-APPLICABLE if IQCORRECTION_DISABLE is set (0x1). Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: DCFILT_ENB
BitField.Notes: if set, enables DC filter (to disable DC offset, set offset value to 0x0). NOT-APPLICABLE if DCFILTER_DISABLE is set (0x1). Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: FORMAT_SIGNEXT
BitField.Notes: if set, enables sign extension (applicable only in 2's complement mode). The data is always sign extended to the nearest byte boundary. NOT-APPLICABLE if DATAFORMAT_DISABLE is set (0x1). Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: FORMAT_TYPE
BitField.Notes: Select offset binary (0x1) or 2's complement (0x0) data type. This sets the incoming data type and is required by the post processing modules for any data conversion. NOT-APPLICABLE if DATAFORMAT_DISABLE is set (0x1). Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: FORMAT_ENABLE
BitField.Notes: Enable data format conversion (see register bits above). NOT-APPLICABLE if DATAFORMAT_DISABLE is set (0x1). Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: RESERVED
BitField.Notes: Reserved for backward compatibility. Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: RESERVED
BitField.Notes: Reserved for backward compatibility. Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: ADC_PN_TYPE_OWR
BitField.Notes: If set, forces ADC_PN_SEL to 0x1, modified pn23 If both ADC_PN_TYPE_OWR and ADC_PN_SEL_OWR are set, they are ignored Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: ENABLE
BitField.Notes: If set, enables channel. A 0x0 to 0x1 transition transfers all the control signals to the respective channel processing module. If a channel is part of a complex signal (I/Q), even channel is the master and the odd channel is the slave. Though a single control is used, both must be individually selected. Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: PN_ERR
BitField.Notes: PN errors. If set, indicates spurious mismatches in sync state. This bit is cleared if OOS is set and is only indicates errors when OOS is cleared. Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: PN_OOS
BitField.Notes: PN Out Of Sync. If set, indicates an OOS status. OOS is set, if 64 consecutive patterns mismatch from the expected pattern. It is cleared, when 16 consecutive patterns match the expected pattern. Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: OVER_RANGE
BitField.Notes: If set, indicates over range. Note that over range is independent of the data path, it indicates an over range over a data transfer period. Software must first clear this bit before initiating a transfer and monitor afterwards. Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: DCFILT_OFFSET[15:0]
BitField.Notes: DC removal (if equipped) offset. This is a 2's complement number added to the incoming data to remove a known DC offset. NOT-APPLICABLE if DCFILTER_DISABLE is set (0x1). Default value: 0x0000

BitField.Name: DCFILT_COEFF[15:0]
BitField.Notes: DC removal filter (if equipped) coefficient. The format is 1.1.14 (sign, integer and fractional bits). NOT-APPLICABLE if DCFILTER_DISABLE is set (0x1). Default value: 0x0000

BitField.Name: IQCOR_COEFF_1[15:0]
BitField.Notes: IQ correction (if equipped) coefficient. If scale & offset is implemented, this is the scale value and the format is 1.1.14 (sign, integer and fractional bits). If matrix multiplication is used, this is the channel I coefficient and the format is 1.1.14 (sign, integer and fractional bits). If SCALECORRECTION_ONLY is set, this implements the scale value correction for the current channel with the format 1.1.14 (sign, integer and fractional bits). NOT-APPLICABLE if IQCORRECTION_DISABLE is set (0x1). Default value: 0x0000

BitField.Name: IQCOR_COEFF_2[15:0]
BitField.Notes: IQ correction (if equipped) coefficient. If scale & offset is implemented, this is the offset value and the format is 2's complement. If matrix multiplication is used, this is the channel Q coefficient and the format is 1.1.14 (sign, integer and fractional bits). NOT-APPLICABLE if IQCORRECTION_DISABLE is set (0x1). Default value: 0x0000

BitField.Name: ADC_PN_SEL[3:0]
BitField.Notes: Selects the PN monitor sequence type (available only if ADC supports it). \\ - 0x0: pn9a (device specific, modified pn9) \\ - 0x1: pn23a (device specific, modified pn23) \\ - 0x4: pn7 (standard O.150) \\ - 0x5: pn15 (standard O.150) \\ - 0x6: pn23 (standard O.150) \\ - 0x7: pn31 (standard O.150) \\ - 0x9: pnX (device specific, e.g. ad9361) \\ - 0x0A: Nibble ramp (Device specific e.g. adrv9001) \\ - 0x0B: 16 bit ramp (Device specific e.g. adrv9001) \\ Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: ADC_DATA_SEL[3:0]
BitField.Notes: Selects the data source to DMA. 0x0: input data (ADC) 0x1: loopback data (DAC) Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: USR_DATATYPE_BE
BitField.Notes: The user data type format- if set, indicates big endian (default is little endian). NOT-APPLICABLE if USERPORTS_DISABLE is set (0x1). Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: USR_DATATYPE_SIGNED
BitField.Notes: The user data type format- if set, indicates signed (2's complement) data (default is unsigned). NOT-APPLICABLE if USERPORTS_DISABLE is set (0x1). Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: USR_DATATYPE_SHIFT[7:0]
BitField.Notes: The user data type format- the amount of right shift for actual samples within the total number of bits. NOT-APPLICABLE if USERPORTS_DISABLE is set (0x1). Default value: 0x00

BitField.Name: USR_DATATYPE_TOTAL_BITS[7:0]
BitField.Notes: The user data type format- number of total bits used for a sample. The total number of bits must be an integer multiple of 8 (byte aligned). NOT-APPLICABLE if USERPORTS_DISABLE is set (0x1). Default value: 0x00

BitField.Name: USR_DATATYPE_BITS[7:0]
BitField.Notes: The user data type format- number of bits in a sample. This indicates the actual sample data bits. NOT-APPLICABLE if USERPORTS_DISABLE is set (0x1). Default value: 0x00

BitField.Name: USR_DECIMATION_M[15:0]
BitField.Notes: This holds the user decimation M value of the channel that is currently being selected on the multiplexer above. The total decimation factor is of the form M/N. NOT-APPLICABLE if USERPORTS_DISABLE is set (0x1). Default value: 0x0000

BitField.Name: USR_DECIMATION_N[15:0]
BitField.Notes: This holds the user decimation N value of the channel that is currently being selected on the multiplexer above. The total decimation factor is of the form M/N. NOT-APPLICABLE if USERPORTS_DISABLE is set (0x1). Default value: 0x0000
